p: The main strength of our study is to rely on data collected by a long‐term surveillance system in primary care. 46 For more than 30 years, ILI case definition remains unchanged as the electronic data collection protocol. This stability is needed to compare influenza activity and epidemiology over several decades in the community: characterization of epidemics, description of cases, understanding of past patterns, monitoring change in trends and estimating influenza vaccine effectiveness. 14, 18 Long‐standing surveillance systems constitute an important and reliable source of information for epidemiological research, to plan for the pressure on health services and to adapt and develop influenza control strategies in the coming years.
